item.title: Algorithmic art: 'Spiral Portal'
item.description: After enjoying Antonio Sánchez Chinchón’s DataCamp tutorial on using R and ggplot2 for algorithmic flower drawing based on Phyllotaxis, I decided to spend an afternoon exploring the techniques he covered. I extended the single flower techniques to a multi-flower image with each flower positioned to form an overall flower shape. The effect makes me think of a portal to a strange multicolor world. A multicolor spiral portal image built in R and ggplot2

item.title: Twinkling Starry Night with JS and Processing (Interactive)
item.description: Background I’ve been learning about algorithmic art, which is a visual art genre that uses an algorithm (usually coded on a computer) to draw interesting or evocative images. While it is possible to do this in many languages, I decided to delve into the Processing language, which is a Java-style language and development environment that is specialised for visualisation. What is this? This is an early casual output of that exploration.

item.title: Algorithmic art: 'Minimalist Rain'
item.description: This was an early exploration of the basic functions of Processing. I rather liked the effect as a minimalist representation of rain. Stylised representation of rain
